title: 1960s Italian Newspaper Type from LaGazzetta Dello Sport
content:
Looking at the headline on this one. Possibly wood type? Anything close to it in digital?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419143458im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Rapha_ItalianType2small_3845.jpg)

Looking at the three faces in this image. Perhaps these are metal or hot-metal face? Not sure when Italian newspapers went to offset or photo type.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419143458im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Rapha_ItalianType1asmall_5195.jpg)
author: onpaperwings

comments.content:
I thought I'd post the one sample in black and white with a little perspective correction in case it helps.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419143458im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Rapha_ItalianType2_5949.jpg)

It looks like [Soft Press](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419143458/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/soft-press/) by Canada Type is pretty close to your sample though not exact.

@tylor.reimer - Thanks. It looks more like Press Gothic than Soft Press likely due to softening of type/process of newspaper printing. The original face may be Metropol designed by Aldo Novarese for Nebiolo in 1967.

> It looks like Soft Press by Canada Type is pretty close

So perhaps it’s Metropol (see the description here: [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/press-gothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419143458/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/press-gothic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/press-gothic/")).

Edit: I’m slow, and don’t refresh pages.

Thanks to those who have offer suggestions and help so far. The biggest issue I am running into is that these were either wood, metal, or hot-metal typefaces that were then printed on cheap newsprint. Some of them have been digitised, but not 100% EXACTLY like the original versions.

So far, this is what I have found:

SARONNI FAVOLOSO  
Actual Typeface: Metropol designed by Aldo Novarese, released by Nebiolo in 1967  
Best Digital Equivalent: Press Gothic Pro - [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/press-gothic/pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419143458/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/press-gothic/pro/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/press-gothic/pro/")

MOSER  
Actual Typeface: Metal Helvetica Black?  
Best Digital Equivalent: Neue Haas Grotesk Pro Display 95 Black - [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/neue-haas-grotesk/pro-display-95-b...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419143458/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/neue-haas-grotesk/pro-display-95-black/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/neue-haas-grotesk/pro-display-95-black/")

FANTASICO  
Actual Typeface: Condensed metal Helvetica? (this was the most difficult to match digitally)  
Best Digital Equivalent: Helvetica Neue 87 Cond Heavy - [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/neue-helvetica/helvetica-87-heavy-...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419143458/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/neue-helvetica/helvetica-87-heavy-condensed/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/neue-helvetica/helvetica-87-heavy-condensed/")

HA BATTUTO DI 343 METRI  
Actual Typeface: Hot-metal Helvetica Condensed Bold Italic?  
Best Digital Equivalent: Helvetica Pro Bold Condensed Oblique - [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica/pro-bold-condensed-oblique/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419143458/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica/pro-bold-condensed-oblique/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica/pro-bold-condensed-oblique/")

Any additional suggestions or help is greatly appreciated.
